person.persName: Benjamin F. Bowen (Bourbon County, Kentucky, justice of the peace, first lieutenant (U.S.A.), farmer, and butcher)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, justice of the peace, soldier, farmer and butcher. Kentucky native. Married to Enfield Ammerman Bowen in Harrison County, Kentucky, on April 3, 1851. Father of Mary Franklin Bowen and Lola Bowen. Resident of Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Bourbon County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Bourbon County in 1861. Served in the Harrison County Kentucky Home Guard (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant. Farmer in Edgar County, Illinois, in 1863. Butcher in Edgar County in 1865.
